elements.description:
`paper-dropdown` is a wrapper for `paper-dropdown-menu` to enable various features like multi-select, search / filter of
   items, key value pair and 2-way binding on value.

  Values can be bound using `value` attribute.

     <paper-dropdown label="Fruit" value="{{value}}">
         <paper-item>Apple</paper-item>
         <paper-item>Banana</paper-item>
         <paper-item>Carrot</paper-item>
         <paper-item>Mango</paper-item>
         <paper-item>Orange</paper-item>
     </paper-dropdown>

  Each item can have a key-label pair where key is what stored in the model but
  label is what user sees. This can be done using `value` attribute for `paper-item`

     <paper-dropdown label="Fruit" value="{{value}}">
         <paper-item value="apple">Apple</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="banana">Banana</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="carrot">Carrot</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="mango">Mango</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="orange">Orange</paper-item>
     </paper-dropdown>

  It also has an optional parameter named `searchable`, which when set to true
  will add a text field at the start of the dropdown which users can use to filter
  out the items in the dropdown.

     <paper-dropdown label="Fruit" value="{{value}}" searchable="true">
         <paper-item value="apple">Apple</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="banana">Banana</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="carrot">Carrot</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="mango">Mango</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="orange">Orange</paper-item>
     </paper-dropdown>

  For multi-select, set `mutli` parameter to true. In this case however, paper-item's
  `value` attribute must be set.

     <paper-dropdown label="Fruit" value="{{value}}" multi="true" searchable="true">
         <paper-item value="apple">Apple</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="banana">Banana</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="carrot">Carrot</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="mango">Mango</paper-item>
         <paper-item value="orange">Orange</paper-item>
     </paper-dropdown>

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the dropdown

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.

properties.name: _parentForm
properties.description: The form that the element is registered to.

properties.name: validator
properties.description: Name of the validator to use.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

properties.name: _validatorMeta
properties.description:
This property is deprecated and should not be used. Use the global
validator meta singleton, `Polymer.IronValidatableBehaviorMeta` instead.

properties.name: validatorType
properties.description:
Namespace for this validator. This property is deprecated and should
not be used. For all intents and purposes, please consider it a
read-only, config-time property.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label shown against the dropdown.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, dropdown will be disabled.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Index of the selected item.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: This is true if the dropdown is in open state

properties.name: searchable
properties.description:
If true, a text field is shown at the top of dropdown which
user can use to search/filter for an item.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message to display when invalid.

properties.name: allowOutsideScroll
properties.description:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.description:
Set to true to disable the floating label. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-container>`'s `noLabelFloat` property.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.description:
Set to true to always float the label. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-container>`'s `alwaysFloatLabel` property.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.description:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
horizontally relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
vertically relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, the `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` properties will
be considered preferences instead of strict requirements when
positioning the dropdown and may be changed if doing so reduces
the area of the dropdown falling outside of `fitInto`.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Whether focus should be restored to the dropdown when the menu closes.

properties.name: multi
properties.description: If true, multiple options can be selected.

properties.name: UP_KEY_CODE
properties.description: Key code for UP Arrow.

properties.name: DOWN_KEY_CODE
properties.description: Key code for DOWN Arrow.

methods.name: validate

params.name: value
params.description:
The value to be validated. By default, it is passed
to the validator's `validate()` function, if a validator is set.

methods.name: _getValidity
methods.description: Returns false if the element is required and don't have any value, and true otherwise.

return.desc: true if `required` is false or if `checked` is true.

methods.name: _filterCheck
methods.description:
Checks if item satisfies the filter condition.
If it satisfies and has to be shown to the user,
true is returned, else false is returned.

Override this method to implement your own custom filter
condition.

params.name: searchText
params.description: Text user entered in search field

methods.name: ready
methods.description:
This method is automatically called when paper-dropdown is
stamped to DOM. ITs main purpose is to initialize the
component's variables.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the dropdown.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the dropdown.

methods.name: _multiChanged
methods.description:
If multi is true, it updates dropdown's menu button
not to close on item select so that user can select
multiple options.

methods.name: _selectedItemsChanged
methods.description: Updates value and selected on _selectedItems change. Note: This function only executes in case of multi select enabled.

methods.name: _updateSelectedItemLabel
methods.description:
Updates selected item's label to customize value shown in
paper-drodown-menu's paper-input.

methods.name: _getItemValue
methods.description: Returns value of given Item.

methods.name: _itemsChanged
methods.description: Updates selected & _attrForSelected on items change.

methods.name: _getItemValueFromItems
methods.description: Returns the value of the item for given index.

methods.name: _getItemLabel
methods.description: Returns the Label for the given Item.

methods.name: _getItemLabelFromItems
methods.description:
Returns the Label shown to user for the item at the
given index.

methods.name: _updateSelected
methods.description:
Updates `selected` property according to `value` property.
Sets selected to -1 if value is not found.

methods.name: _updateValue
methods.description: Updates `value` property according to `selected` property.

methods.name: _onOpenedChanged
methods.description:
Called whenever `opened` changes.
Fires `opened` or `closed` events.
Also, clears `_searchText` variable on close.

methods.name: _stopEventPropagation
methods.description: Stops event propagation if up/down keys is not pressed.

methods.name: _filter
methods.description: Shows/Hides listbox items based on searchText

params.name: searchText
params.description: Text to be matched in item's label.

behaviors.description:
Use `Polymer.PaperDropdownBehavior` to implement a custom validation
and filter methods.

It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.
